poem:
Title: In Commemoration of Frugality

In the realm of thought, where no stupidity lies -
no folly in the laughter, nor the sobering cries.
Mirror the absurdity, draped in clever guise,
where Frasier is a villain, wisdom's disguise.
Yet through the cacophony, the truth oft defies,
Under the flag of kindness, mania multiplies.
Beware the alternative, the new world demonizes.
